channel.description: Recent content in Network on Memo Tut

item.title: Experience pyATS!
item.description: *Note Rather than about automation, it’s featured a lot on the advent calender What is pyATS/Genie? Various things can be done automatically, but how should I try it? For those who want to introduce it to people like, I do not know, but I want to touch it anyway! It will be an article for people such as Prerequisites You have a DevNet account. It’s not like a Cisco partner account, it’s something anyone can create Please make it at this opportunity.

item.title: Simple network operation by linking Cisco DNA Center and Tact Switch
item.description: #Introduction This article was posted as the eighth day of Cisco Systems Japan Advent Calendar 2019 by volunteers from Cisco. 2017 version: https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2017/cisco 2018 version: https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2018/cisco 2019 version: https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/cisco What do you want to do? Network operation that anyone can do Cisco’s best-selling controller for Cisco DNA Center ~~ Stema ~~ Tips demo Balancing work and material Common cool topics ~~ Policy, AI or Assurance ~ ~, but rather quiet operation that is often heard Reuse of goods bought in 2017 What is this?

item.title: I tried to automatically generate a port management table from Config of L2SW
item.description: #Introduction In the previous article, I introduced an example of automatically generating Config from the port management table. I tried to automatically generate L2SW Config from the port management table + parameter table + Jinja2 template In some cases, you may want to create a port management table from the already created Config. This time, using a Python parser library called TTP (Template Text Parser), I automatically generated a CSV format port management table from the L2SW Config file.
